definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: They introduced the idea that children could learn to read as babies.

sentences.english: First, she taught me how to read.

sentences.chinese: 大班儿童能够自主阅读，对认字的兴趣比较大。

sentences.english: Then the Urchin Cop teaches them how to spell the words and write a composition.
sentences.chinese: 孩子王便从头教他们认字作文。

sentences.english: Johnny, who's almost 10, can't read, but no one is worried.
sentences.chinese: 约翰尼快10岁了，但他还不会认字。

sentences.english: When teaching the students characters, we should also encourage them to remember the characters by their own means.
sentences.chinese: 启发学生多动脑，用自己认为容易记认的方法认字。
